column4: Is there a way to backup all the f-spot data so that I dont have to sort them all when I redo my machine
just backup your home folder, and you won' t need to redo any of your config, just re install the apps
beryl is eye candy,  menu animations, transparent borders and stuff like that,  if you want to know what it looks like do a search on youtube there are loads of videos
at least it didnT' use to
check the model here and in the forum  www.ubuntuforums.org  https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardwareSupport
try lspci in the terminal , it might tell you something but I can't garranty
it unfortunatly tells me very little.
menu > system > prefs > hardware info, it will tell you a lot more, or a lot less depending on how you look at it
might be the image ratio, I suggest you inquire in #vlc
Oh there is a VLC channel okay

yes, just drop them in that themes folder in the emblem subfolder , for each size, you also need to give it a txt files,  see the content of the emblem folder for more info, it's pretty selfexplanaroty
What I should have asked is where can I get them? I have checked www.gnome-look.org already.
no answer there,  you can possibly grab some from other icon thems and give them other names
not unless they make a deb package
